questions.text: When was the first constitution of Pakistan enacted?
questions.explanation: The first constitution of Pakistan was enacted on March 23, 1956, establishing Pakistan as an Islamic Republic.

questions.text: Which constitution of Pakistan introduced the Presidential form of government?
questions.explanation: The 1962 Constitution introduced the Presidential form of government under Ayub Khan.

questions.text: The 18th Amendment to the Constitution was passed in which year?
questions.explanation: The 18th Amendment was passed on April 8, 2010, making significant changes to Pakistan's federal structure.

questions.text: Who was the first President of Pakistan under the 1956 Constitution?
questions.explanation: Iskander Mirza became the first President of Pakistan under the 1956 Constitution.

questions.text: The Objectives Resolution was passed by the Constituent Assembly in:
questions.explanation: The Objectives Resolution was passed on March 12, 1949, laying the foundation for Pakistan's constitutional development.

questions.text: Which amendment made Islam the state religion of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Islam was declared the state religion in the original 1973 Constitution, not through an amendment.

questions.text: The 1973 Constitution was passed during the government of:
questions.explanation: The 1973 Constitution was passed on April 12, 1973, during the government of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto.

questions.text: Which amendment restored the Parliamentary form of government in Pakistan?
questions.explanation: The 13th Amendment (1997) removed the President's power to dissolve the National Assembly, restoring the Parliamentary system.

questions.text: How many schedules are there in the 1973 Constitution of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: The 1973 Constitution has 7 schedules dealing with various matters like oaths, languages, and distribution of powers.

questions.text: The Federal Shariat Court was established under which constitutional amendment?
questions.explanation: The Federal Shariat Court was established under the 8th Amendment in 1980 during Zia-ul-Haq's regime.
